Condition.Diagnostic: Version available for H7R/S

RefParameter.Name: MAX_VOLUMES_VALUE
RefParameter.Comment: Max value for the volumes parameter

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Please Disable FREERTOS to activate this mode
Please Disable FREERTOS to activate this mode
Please Enable FREERTOS to activate this mode

Condition.Diagnostic: Used only for Standallone mode (FreeRTOS is disabled).

RefParameter.Name: ENABLE_SD_INIT

Condition.Diagnostic: Used only for Standallone mode (FreeRTOS is disabled).

RefParameter.Description: Let the Low-level Diskio driver initialize the SD driver.

RefParameter.Name: ENABLE_SD_DMA_CACHE_MAINTENANCE

Condition.Diagnostic: Used only for Standallone mode (FreeRTOS is disabled).

RefParameter.Description:
Enable the define below to activate a cache maintenance at each read and write operation.
Requires: Under condition (DMA RTOS) mode or (DMA Standlone) mode

PossibleValue.Comment: Only DOS/Windows style drive prefix in numeric ID
Also DOS/Windows style drive prefix in string ID
Also Unix style drive prefix in string ID

RefParameter.Name: USE_DMA_CODE_SD

Condition.Diagnostic: Choice possible when FreeRTOS is disabled.

RefParameter.Description:
When enabled, generate code based on sd_diskio_dma_template.* files (recommended choice). Please ensure that the DMA controller to be used is properly configured.
When disabled, generate code based on sd_diskio_template.* files

RefParameter.Name: DISKIO_CODE
RefParameter.Description: TO DO

RefParameter.Name: BOARD_NAME
RefParameter.Description: No board available, as no custom configuration on-going/possible on that series

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_READONLY
RefParameter.Description:
Setting FS_READONLY to 1 defines read only configuration.
This removes writing functions: f_write, f_sync, f_unlink, f_mkdir, f_chmod, f_rename, f_truncate and useless f_getfree.
Dependency: FS_READONLY = 1 (Enabled) possible as FS_LOCK = 0.

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_READONLY
RefParameter.Description:
Setting FS_READONLY to 1 defines read only configuration.
This removes writing functions: f_write, f_sync, f_unlink, f_mkdir, f_chmod, f_rename, f_truncate and useless f_getfree.
Dependency: FS_READONLY = 1 (Enabled) not possible: it requires FS_LOCK = 0.

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_MINIMIZE

Condition.Diagnostic: Function list updated for R0.12

RefParameter.Description:
The FS_MINIMIZE option defines minimization level to remove some functions.
0: All basic functions are enabled.
1: f_stat(), f_getfree(), f_unlink(), f_mkdir(), f_truncate() and f_rename() functions are removed.
2: f_opendir(), f_readdir() and f_closedir() are removed in addition to 1.
3: f_lseek() function is removed in addition to 2.

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_MINIMIZE
RefParameter.Description:
The FS_MINIMIZE option defines minimization level to remove some functions.
0: All basic functions are enabled.
1: f_stat(), f_getfree(), f_unlink(), f_mkdir(), f_chmod(), f_utime(), f_truncate() and f_rename() functions are removed.
2: f_opendir(), f_readdir() and f_closedir() are removed in addition to 1.
3: f_lseek() function is removed in addition to 2.

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_STRFUNC
RefParameter.Description:
To enable string functions (f_gets, f_putc, f_puts, ...), set USE_STRFUNC to 1 or 2.
When set to 2, makes a LF -> CRLF conversion.

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_FIND
RefParameter.Description: This option switches filtered directory read feature and related functions, f_findfirst() and f_findnext(). (0:Disable or 1:Enable).

RefParameter.Name: FF_PRINT_LLI
RefParameter.Description: This option switches support for long integer argument in f_printf. When this feature is enabled, C standard needs to be C99 or later and math.h is included in ff.c.

RefParameter.Name: FF_PRINT_FLOAT

PossibleValue.Comment: Enable floating point argument in type 'f', 'e' and 'E'
Enableit with decimal separator ',' instead of '.'

RefParameter.Description: This option switches support for floating point argument in f_printf. When this feature is enabled, C standard needs to be C99 or later.

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_MKFS
RefParameter.Description: To enable f_mkfs function, set USE_MKFS to 1 (Enabled) and set FS_READONLY to 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_FORWARD
RefParameter.Description: To enable f_forward function, set USE_FORWARD to 1 (Enabled) and set FS_TINY to 1 (Enabled).

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_LABEL
RefParameter.Description: To enable volume label functions, set USE_LABEL to 1 (Enabled).

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_FASTSEEK
RefParameter.Description: To enable fast seek feature, set USE_FASTSEEK to 1 (Enabled).

RefParameter.Name: FF_CODE_PAGE
RefParameter.Description: The CODE_PAGE specifies the OEM code page to be used on the target system. Incorrect setting of the code page can cause a file open failure.

RefParameter.Name: FF_CODE_PAGE
RefParameter.Description:
The CODE_PAGE specifies the OEM code page to be used on the target system. Incorrect setting of the code page can cause a file open failure.
Dependencies: CODE_PAGE = 1 (ASCII only) possible as USE_LFN = 0 (Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: FF_CODE_PAGE
RefParameter.Description:
The CODE_PAGE specifies the OEM code page to be used on the target system. Incorrect setting of the code page can cause a file open failure.
Dependencies: CODE_PAGE = 1 (ASCII only) possible as USE_LFN = 0 (Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: FF_CODE_PAGE
RefParameter.Description:
The CODE_PAGE specifies the OEM code page to be used on the target system. Incorrect setting of the code page can cause a file open failure.
Dependency: CODE_PAGE = 1 (ASCII only) possible as USE_LFN = 0 (Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: FF_CODE_PAGE
RefParameter.Description:
The CODE_PAGE specifies the OEM code page to be used on the target system. Incorrect setting of the code page can cause a file open failure.
Dependency: CODE_PAGE = 1 (ASCII only) not possible: it requires USE_LFN = 0 (Disabled).

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_LFN

PossibleValue.Comment: Enabled with static working buffer on the BSS
Enabled with dynamic working buffer on the STACK
Enabled with dynamic working buffer on the HEAP

RefParameter.Description:
The USE_LFN option switches the LFN feature.
- 0: Disable LFN feature. MAX_LFN has no effect.
- 1: Enable LFN with static working buffer on the BSS. Always NOT reentrant.
- 2: Enable LFN with dynamic working buffer on the STACK.
- 3: Enable LFN with dynamic working buffer on the HEAP.
To enable LFN feature, Unicode handling functions ff_convert() and ff_wtoupper() function must be added to the project.
The LFN working buffer occupies (MAX_LFN + 1) * 2 bytes. When use stack for the working buffer, take care on stack overflow.
When use heap memory for the working buffer, memory management functions, ff_memalloc() and ff_memfree(), must be added to the project.
Dependency:
USE_LFN = 0 (Disabled) not possible : it requires LFN_UNICODE = 0 (ANSI/OEM).

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_LFN

PossibleValue.Comment: Enabled with static working buffer on the BSS
Enabled with dynamic working buffer on the STACK
Enabled with dynamic working buffer on the HEAP

RefParameter.Description:
The USE_LFN option switches the LFN feature.
- 0: Disable LFN feature. MAX_LFN has no effect.
- 1: Enable LFN with static working buffer on the BSS. Always NOT reentrant.
- 2: Enable LFN with dynamic working buffer on the STACK.
- 3: Enable LFN with dynamic working buffer on the HEAP.
To enable LFN feature, Unicode handling functions ff_convert() and ff_wtoupper() function must be added to the project.
The LFN working buffer occupies (MAX_LFN + 1) * 2 bytes. When use stack for the working buffer, take care on stack overflow.
When use heap memory for the working buffer, memory management functions, ff_memalloc() and ff_memfree(), must be added to the project.
Dependencies:
1) USE_LFN = 0 (Disabled) not possible : it requires LFN_UNICODE = 0 (ANSI/OEM).
2) USE_LFN = 1 (Enabled with static working buffer on the BSS) not possible when FF_FS_REENTRANT = 1 (Enabled).

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_LFN

PossibleValue.Comment: Enabled with static working buffer on the BSS
Enabled with dynamic working buffer on the STACK
Enabled with dynamic working buffer on the HEAP

RefParameter.Description:
The USE_LFN option switches the LFN feature.
- 0: Disable LFN feature. MAX_LFN has no effect.
- 1: Enable LFN with static working buffer on the BSS. Always NOT reentrant.
- 2: Enable LFN with dynamic working buffer on the STACK.
- 3: Enable LFN with dynamic working buffer on the HEAP.
To enable LFN feature, Unicode handling functions ff_convert() and ff_wtoupper() function must be added to the project.
The LFN working buffer occupies (MAX_LFN + 1) * 2 bytes. When use stack for the working buffer, take care on stack overflow.
When use heap memory for the working buffer, memory management functions, ff_memalloc() and ff_memfree(), must be added to the project.
Dependency:
USE_LFN = 1 (Enabled with static working buffer on the BSS) not possible when FF_FS_REENTRANT = 1 (Enabled).

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_LFN

PossibleValue.Comment: Enabled with static working buffer on the BSS
Enabled with dynamic working buffer on the STACK
Enabled with dynamic working buffer on the HEAP

RefParameter.Description:
The USE_LFN option switches the LFN feature.
- 0: Disable LFN feature. MAX_LFN has no effect.
- 1: Enable LFN with static working buffer on the BSS. Always NOT reentrant.
- 2: Enable LFN with dynamic working buffer on the STACK.
- 3: Enable LFN with dynamic working buffer on the HEAP.
To enable LFN feature, Unicode handling functions ff_convert() and ff_wtoupper() function must be added to the project.
The LFN working buffer occupies (MAX_LFN + 1) * 2 bytes. When use stack for the working buffer, take care on stack overflow.
When use heap memory for the working buffer, memory management functions, ff_memalloc() and ff_memfree(), must be added to the project.
Dependency:
All choices available as FF_FS_REENTRANT = 0 (disabled) and LFN_UNICODE = 0 (ANSI/OEM).

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_LFN

PossibleValue.Comment: Enabled with static working buffer on the BSS
Enabled with dynamic working buffer on the STACK
Enabled with dynamic working buffer on the HEAP

RefParameter.Description:
The USE_LFN option switches the LFN feature.
- 0: Disable LFN feature. MAX_LFN has no effect.
- 1: Enable LFN with static working buffer on the BSS. Always NOT reentrant.
- 2: Enable LFN with dynamic working buffer on the STACK.
- 3: Enable LFN with dynamic working buffer on the HEAP.
To enable LFN feature, Unicode handling functions ff_convert() and ff_wtoupper() function must be added to the project.
The LFN working buffer occupies (MAX_LFN + 1) * 2 bytes. When use stack for the working buffer, take care on stack overflow.
When use heap memory for the working buffer, memory management functions, ff_memalloc() and ff_memfree(), must be added to the project.
Dependency:
All choices available as FF_FS_REENTRANT = 0 (disabled) and LFN_UNICODE = 0 (ANSI/OEM).

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_LFN

PossibleValue.Comment: Enabled with static working buffer on the BSS
Enabled with dynamic working buffer on the STACK
Enabled with dynamic working buffer on the HEAP

RefParameter.Description:
The USE_LFN option switches the LFN feature.
- 0: Disable LFN feature. MAX_LFN has no effect.
- 1: Enable LFN with static working buffer on the BSS. Always NOT reentrant.
- 2: Enable LFN with dynamic working buffer on the STACK.
- 3: Enable LFN with dynamic working buffer on the HEAP.
To enable LFN feature, Unicode handling functions ff_convert() and ff_wtoupper() function must be added to the project.
The LFN working buffer occupies (MAX_LFN + 1) * 2 bytes. When use stack for the working buffer, take care on stack overflow.
When use heap memory for the working buffer, memory management functions, ff_memalloc() and ff_memfree(), must be added to the project.
Dependency:
All choices available as FF_FS_REENTRANT = 0 (disabled) and LFN_UNICODE = 0 (ANSI/OEM).

RefParameter.Name: FF_MAX_LFN
RefParameter.Description: Maximum LFN length to handle.

RefParameter.Name: FF_LFN_UNICODE
RefParameter.Description: This option switches the character encoding on the API when LFN is enabled (FF_USE_LFN = 1).

RefParameter.Name: FF_LFN_UNICODE
RefParameter.Description: To switch the character encoding on the FatFs API to Unicode, enable LFN feature (USE_LFN set to Enabled) and set LFN_UNICODE to 1 (Unicode).

RefParameter.Name: FF_LFN_UNICODE
RefParameter.Description:
To switch the character encoding on the FatFs API to Unicode, enable LFN feature (USE_LFN set to Enabled) and set LFN_UNICODE to 1 (Unicode).
Dependency:
Must be set to 0 (ANSI/OEM) as USE_LFN is set to 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Name: FF_STRF_ENCODE
RefParameter.Description:
When Unicode API is enabled, character encoding on the all FatFs API is switched to Unicode.
STRF_ENCODE option selects the character encoding on the file to be read/written via string functions, f_gets(), f_putc(), f_puts and f_printf().
- 0: Read/Write a character in ANSI/OEM.
- 1: Read/Write a character in UTF-16LE.
- 2: Read/Write a character in UTF-16BE,
- 3: Read/Write a character in UTF-8
Dependency: This option has no effect when LFN_UNICODE is 0 (ANSI/OEM).

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_RPATH
RefParameter.Description:
The FS_RPATH option configures relative path feature.
- 0: Disable relative path feature and remove related functions.
- 1: Enable relative path. f_chdrive() and f_chdir() function are available.
- 2: f_getcwd() function is available in addition to 1.
Note that output of the f_readdir() function is affected by this option.

RefParameter.Name: FF_VOLUMES
RefParameter.Description: Number of volumes (logical drives) to be used.

RefParameter.Name: FF_LBA64
RefParameter.Description: Support for 64-bit LBA (Logical Block Addressing).

RefParameter.Name: FF_MIN_GPT

Condition.Diagnostic: Requires: FF_LBA64 = 1

RefParameter.Description: Minimum number of sectors to switch GPT format to create partition in f_mkfs() and f_fdisk().

RefParameter.Name: FF_VOLUMES
RefParameter.Description: Number of volumes (logical drives) to be used.

RefParameter.Name: FF_VOLUMES
RefParameter.Description: Number of volumes (logical drives) to be used.

RefParameter.Description: Number of volumes (logical drives) to be used.

RefParameter.Name: FF_VOLUMES
RefParameter.Description: Number of volumes (logical drives) to be used.

RefParameter.Name: FF_MAX_SS
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum sector size to be handled.
Four possible values: 512, 1024, 2048, 4096.
Always set 512 for memory card and hard disk but a larger value may be required for on-board flash memory, floppy disk and optical disk.
When MAX_SS is larger than 512, it configures FatFs to variable sector size and GET_SECTOR_SIZE command must be implemented to the disk_ioctl() function.

RefParameter.Name: FF_MIN_SS

Condition.Diagnostic: Four possible values: 512, 1024, 2048 and 4096.

RefParameter.Description:
Minimum sector size to be handled.
Note: must be less than or equal to FF_MAX_SS.

RefParameter.Name: FF_MIN_SS

Condition.Diagnostic: Three possible values: 512, 1024 and 2048.

RefParameter.Description:
Minimum sector size to be handled.
Note: must be less than or equal to FF_MAX_SS.

RefParameter.Name: FF_MIN_SS

Condition.Diagnostic: Two possible values: 512 and 1024.

RefParameter.Description:
Minimum sector size to be handled.
Note: must be less than or equal to FF_MAX_SS.

RefParameter.Name: FF_MIN_SS
RefParameter.Description:
Minimum sector size to be handled.
Note: must be less than or equal to FF_MAX_SS.

RefParameter.Name: FF_MULTI_PARTITION
RefParameter.Description:
When set to 0 (Disabled), each volume is bound to the same physical drive number and it can mount only first primaly partition.
When it is set to 1 (Enabled), each volume is tied to the partitions listed in VolToPart[].
Warning:
The volToPart variable contains the "volume management table" defined by the user (required when FF_MULTI_PARTITION != 0).
It is generated in a USER SECTION so that it can be completed by the user.

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_TRIM
RefParameter.Description: This option switches ATA-TRIM feature. (0:Disable or 1:Enable) To enable Trim feature, also CTRL_TRIM command should be implemented to the disk_ioctl() function.

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_NOFSINFO
RefParameter.Description:
If you need to know correct free space on the FAT32 volume, set bit 0 of this option and f_getfree() function at first time after volume mount will force a full FAT scan.
Bit 1 controls the last allocated cluster number as bit 0.
- bit0=0: Use free cluster count in the FSINFO if available.
- bit0=1: Do not trust free cluster count in the FSINFO.
- bit1=0: Use last allocated cluster number in the FSINFO if available.
- bit1=1: Do not trust last allocated cluster number in the FSINFO.

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_TINY
RefParameter.Description:
When FS_TINY is set to 1, FatFs uses the sector buffer in the file system object instead of the sector buffer in the individual file object for file data transfer.
This reduces memory consumption 512 bytes each file object.

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_NORTC
RefParameter.Description:
The FF_FS_NORTC option switches timestamp feature.
- If the system does not have an RTC function or valid timestamp is not needed, set FF_FS_NORTC to 1 (Fixed timestamp) to disable the timestamp feature. All objects modified by FatFs will have a fixed timestamp defined by FF_NORTC_MON, FF_NORTC_MDAY and FF_NORTC_YEAR.
- When timestamp feature is enabled (Dynamic timestamp), get_fattime() function need to be added to the project to read current time form RTC and generate a timestamp. FF_NORTC_MON, FF_NORTC_MDAY and FF_NORTC_YEAR have no effect.

RefParameter.Name: FF_NORTC_YEAR

Condition.Diagnostic: New default value since R0.13 version

RefParameter.Description: As FS_NORTC is enabled, it is the year part of the timestamps used by Fatfs.

RefParameter.Name: FF_NORTC_YEAR

Condition.Diagnostic: Available in CubeMx since R0.11 version

RefParameter.Description: As FS_NORTC is enabled, it is the year part of the timestamps used by Fatfs.

RefParameter.Name: FF_NORTC_YEAR
RefParameter.Description: Useless as FS_NORTC is disabled (otherwise, it is the year part of the timestamps used by Fatfs).

RefParameter.Name: FF_NORTC_MON

Condition.Diagnostic: New default value since R0.13 version

RefParameter.Description: As FS_NORTC is enabled, it is the month part of the timestamps used by Fatfs.

RefParameter.Name: FF_NORTC_MON

Condition.Diagnostic: Available in CubeMx since R0.11 version

RefParameter.Description: As FS_NORTC is enabled, it is the month part of the timestamps used by Fatfs.

RefParameter.Name: FF_NORTC_MON
RefParameter.Description: Useless as FS_NORTC is disabled (otherwise, it is the month part of the timestamps used by Fatfs).

RefParameter.Name: FF_NORTC_MDAY

Condition.Diagnostic: Available in CubeMx since R0.11 version

RefParameter.Description: As FS_NORTC is enabled, it is the day part of the timestamps used by Fatfs.

RefParameter.Name: FF_NORTC_MDAY

Condition.Diagnostic: Available in CubeMx since R0.11 version

RefParameter.Description: As FS_NORTC is enabled, it is the day part of the timestamps used by Fatfs.

RefParameter.Name: FF_NORTC_MDAY

Condition.Diagnostic: Available in CubeMx since R0.11 version

RefParameter.Description: As FS_NORTC is enabled, it is the day part of the timestamps used by Fatfs.

RefParameter.Name: FF_NORTC_MDAY
RefParameter.Description: Useless as FS_NORTC is disabled (otherwise, it is the day part of the timestamps used by Fatfs).

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_REENTRANT

Condition.Diagnostic: Can be changed when FreeRTOS is enabled (not forced to 1)

RefParameter.Description:
The FS_REENTRANT option switches the re-entrancy (thread safe) of the FatFs module.
Baremetal mode: value read-only set to 0 RTOS mode is configurable as below: - 0: Disable re-entrancy. FS_TIMEOUT have no effect.
- 1: Enable re-entrancy. Also user provided synchronization handlers, ff_mutex_create(), ff_mutex_delete(), ff_mutex_take(), and ff_mutex_give() Sync functions must be added to the project. Samples are available in ffsystem.C

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_REENTRANT
RefParameter.Description:
The FS_REENTRANT option switches the re-entrancy (thread safe) of the FatFs module.
- 0: Disable re-entrancy. FS_TIMEOUT have no effect.
Dependency:
Forced to disabled when FreeRTOS is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: Timeout period in unit of time ticks

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_LOCK
RefParameter.Description: To enable file lock control feature, set FS_LOCK to 1 or greater. The value defines how many files can be opened simultaneously.

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_EXPAND

Condition.Diagnostic: Available in CubeMx since R0.12 version

RefParameter.Description:
Flag to enable the f_expand function (0:Disabled or 1:Enabled).
The f_expand function prepares or allocates a contiguous data area to the file.
Note: can be enabled as FF_FS_READONLY equals to 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_EXPAND

Condition.Diagnostic: Available in CubeMx since R0.12 version

RefParameter.Description:
Flag to enable the f_expand function (0:Disabled or 1:Enabled).
The f_expand function prepares or allocates a contiguous data area to the file.
Note: forced to disabled as FF_FS_READONLY equals to 1 (Enabled)

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_EXPAND
RefParameter.Description: Hidden parameter when version less than 12.

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_CHMOD

Condition.Diagnostic: Available in CubeMx since R0.12 version

RefParameter.Description:
Flag to enable the f_chmod function (0:Disabled or 1:Enabled).
The f_chmod function changes the attribute of a file or sub-directory.
Note: can be enabled as FF_FS_READONLY equals to 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_CHMOD

Condition.Diagnostic: Available in CubeMx since R0.12 version

RefParameter.Description:
Flag to enable the f_chmod function (0:Disabled or 1:Enabled).
The f_chmod function changes the attribute of a file or sub-directory.
Note: forced to disabled as FF_FS_READONLY equals to 1 (Enabled)

RefParameter.Name: FF_USE_CHMOD
RefParameter.Description: Hidden parameter when version less than 12.

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_EXFAT

Condition.Diagnostic: Available in CubeMx since R0.12 version

RefParameter.Description:
This option switches support of exFAT file system. (0:Disabled or 1:Enabled).
When enable exFAT, also LFN needs to be enabled. (FF_USE_LFN >= 1).
Note that enabling exFAT discards C89 compatibility.
Warning:
Extracted from http://elm-chan.org/fsw/ff/doc/appnote.html#exfat
The exFAT filesystem is a patent of Microsoft Corporation.
- the exFAT feature of FatFs is an implementation based on US. Pat. App. Pub. No. 2009/0164440 A1.
- when enable the exFAT for the commercial products, a license by Microsoft will be needed depends on the final destination of the products.

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_EXFAT

Condition.Diagnostic: Forced to disabled as FF_USE_LFN equals to 0 (Disabled)

RefParameter.Description:
This option switches support of exFAT file system. (0:Disabled or 1:Enabled).
When enable exFAT, also LFN needs to be enabled. (FF_USE_LFN >= 1).
Note that enabling exFAT discards C89 compatibility.
Warning:
Extracted from http://elm-chan.org/fsw/ff/doc/appnote.html#exfat
The exFAT filesystem is a patent of Microsoft Corporation.
- the exFAT feature of FatFs is an implementation based on US. Pat. App. Pub. No. 2009/0164440 A1.
- when enable the exFAT for the commercial products, a license by Microsoft will be needed depends on the final destination of the products.

RefParameter.Name: FF_FS_EXFAT
RefParameter.Description: Hidden parameter when version != 12.

RefParameter.Name: FF_LFN_BUF

Condition.Diagnostic: Available in R0.15

RefParameter.Description: Buffer size to store "long filename".

RefParameter.Name: FF_LFN_BUF
RefParameter.Description: Hidden parameter when USE_LFN=0 or when Fatfs version is older than 15.

RefParameter.Name: FF_SFN_BUF

Condition.Diagnostic: Available in R0.15: maximum value is LFN_BUF

RefParameter.Description: Buffer size to store ""alternate filename" (short filename).

RefParameter.Name: FF_SFN_BUF
RefParameter.Description: Hidden parameter when USE_LFN=0 or when Fatfs version is older than 15.

Condition.Diagnostic: Equals to 1 if SDIO mode on
Equals to 1 if SDRAM mode on
Equals to 1 if SRAM mode on
Equals to 1 if USB mode on
Equals to 1 if USER mode on
Active only when the AzureRTOS (ThreadX,FileX,..) are deactivated
Active only with at least one SRAM / PSRAM / Muxed PSRAM / LCD Interface configured and FreeRTOS not in native mode
Active only when the AzureRTOS (ThreadX,FileX,..) are deactivated
Active only with SDIO/SDMMC IP configured in a SD mode
Active only when the AzureRTOS (ThreadX,FileX,..) are deactivated
Active only with USB Host (class MSC) middleware and FreeRTOS not in native mode
Active only when the AzureRTOS (ThreadX,FileX,..) are deactivated
Active only if FreeRTOS interface is not Native
